pullRequest.title: Bulk-Data Import Operation and API #671
pullRequest.bodyText:
Develop helper code to build the OperationDefinition for $import


Update import.json with the generated OperationDefinition


Develop helper code to generate tests for $import Parameters object


Included $import parameters examples as part of testdata/


Introduce BulkDataImportUtil and Refactor ImportOperation

Refactor the method signature for import



Refactor $export-status to $bulkdata-status


Updated BulkDataUtil to BulkDataExportUtil


Add FHIRConfiguration entry for validBaseUrls


Refactor the configuration tests


Added importBulkData (import is reserved, otherwise the method would
be called import)


Refactor PollingLocationResponse to support $import and $export

increased test coverage to 100% for class covering the various cases
of use and branches in the model and writers



Convert the PollingLocationResponse writer to honor the system wide
pretty printing setting from FHIRConfiguration


Increase Test Coverage


Add support for custom fields (datasourceinfo is base64 as it is
serialized into a name-value pair)


Update FHIRServerUsersGuide.md (refactor $export and update for
$import)


Add IT for $import - ImportOperationTest


Remove unused configuration tests


Refactor ExportOperationTest for changes to serialization


Update the fhir-server-config.json to include validBaseUrls


Add test-import.ndjson for Integration Testing


Add defensive programming on the number of inputs


Fix issue where ResourceTypes are always split by a space in request


Reference to
https://github.com/smart-on-fhir/bulk-import/blob/master/import.md


Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide pbastide@us.ibm.com

commit.message:
Bulk-Data Import Operation and API #671

- Develop helper code to build the OperationDefinition for $import
- Update import.json with the generated OperationDefinition
- Develop helper code to generate tests for $import Parameters object
- Included $import parameters examples as part of testdata/
- Introduce BulkDataImportUtil and Refactor ImportOperation
	- Refactor the method signature for import
- Refactor $export-status to $bulkdata-status
- Updated BulkDataUtil to BulkDataExportUtil
- Add FHIRConfiguration entry for validBaseUrls
- Refactor the configuration tests
- Added importBulkData (import is reserved, otherwise the method would
be called import)
- Refactor PollingLocationResponse to support $import and $export
	- increased test coverage to 100% for class covering the various cases
of use and branches in the model and writers
- Convert the PollingLocationResponse writer to honor the system wide
pretty printing setting from FHIRConfiguration
- Increase Test Coverage
- Add support for custom fields (datasourceinfo is base64 as it is
serialized into a name-value pair)
- Update FHIRServerUsersGuide.md (refactor $export and update for
$import)
- Add IT for $import - ImportOperationTest
- Remove unused configuration tests
- Refactor ExportOperationTest for changes to serialization
- Update the fhir-server-config.json to include validBaseUrls
- Add test-import.ndjson for Integration Testing
- Add defensive programming on the number of inputs
- Fix issue where ResourceTypes are always split by a space in `request`

- Reference to
https://github.com/smart-on-fhir/bulk-import/blob/master/import.md

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

Updates to Refine the Import Operation #671

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: not sure if assigning a random id to resource with null id is the right approach.  because assigning random id doesn't help to preserver the relation between resources. so I chose to regard those resource with empty id as invalid resources which will be handled by the exception handler codes automatically.
need to remove the space.
not sure if any change made to the 2 above function ...
changing the codes to 3 lines seems a little bit weird for me.
because dsType is only used once, so, not really sure if it's good to use a local variable for it.
the wrapping seems strange to me, I'm not sure what's the correct pattern, but we do need a unified pattern for this.
maybe not needed now

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env bash

nodes.bodyText:
what's the meaning of import type here? can not find the definition in spec.
export has system, group and patient types, not sure if import type is appropriate for import.
is checkAndValidateJob the same for both export and import? if yes, not sure it's in BulkDataExportUtil ...
is checkAndValidateJob the same for both export and import? if yes, not sure it's in BulkDataExportUtil ...

PUT /ibm/api/batch/jobinstances/job instance id?action=stop
DELETE /ibm/api/batch/jobinstances/job instance id
(1) always use jobinstanceId instead of jobexecution id to stop or delete a job.
(2) if the job is running, deleting it directly will fail, so have to stop it first, and the delete it.
In the spec, there is no "stop" and then continue the stopped job.   so bulkdata delete = javabatch stop + delete.
we can not delete a running javabatch job, we have to stop it first and then delete it.
did some quick tests, and seems the space is added in the request to javabatch. the defensive codes here is good!

just found it's by line 206
String resourceType = String.join(", ", types);

we have to discuss and pass the import results from the javabatch job via exit status of the job.
it's a little bit more complicated then the export results, for export, the exit status is very simple as in this example:
Patient[5000,200],Obervation[5000,400], and the detail export details(including urls and counts) are generated in the export operation side.
For import, according to the spec, we have to pass much more info from the import job to the operation codes - e.g, we may have to pass the inputUrl and count together, or we will have to use something like a consistent sequence number for the inputUrl to uniquely identify the inputUrl.  we we will also have to pass the url to the error .ndjson for the inputUrl, or at least with a tag to tell that there is error during the import, and operation code can generate the url which aligns with the error ndjson gernated in the job side.
Maybe a simple pattern like this to pass the import status from the job to operation:
[5000,0],[6000,30]
means the first inputUrl all imported successfully with total 5000 resources.
and the second inputUrl imported 6000 resources, but with 30 import failures.
because this class is used for both import and export, so seems better to rename the class to something like BulkDataJobExecutionResponse?
because this class is used by both import and export, so seems better to change to something like BulkDataJobInstanceRequest?
too many empty lines in this file, better to remove some of them.
Interesting and nice FHIRPath usage here!!
should we add 5 as a constant?

this means e.g, for https input url, user will have to change server config to add the BaseUrl for it first, maybe better to make the check to be configurable, like by default enable, but user can choose to disable the check.

The contentEncoding parameter for https storageDetail in the Spec is a little bit strange for me, because per my understanding, this contentencoding info should be in the response header when accessing the https url, so seems doesn't make too much sense to add it to the storageDetail.
Maybe reasonable for other storage types which don't have such build-in contentencoding info...
nice and cool generator!
for import, do you want a COS implementation or https implementation?
